SENT.plain: This case report highlights the emergence of new complications associated with old procedures as the frequency of their use increases
A 29-year-old man with aplastic anemia was admitted for a bone marrow transplant
Before this procedure, a Hickman line was inserted
This was followed by hoarseness of voice
An examination revealed an immobile left vocal cord
Further investigations did not show any cause for this complication
Therefore, the hoarseness and vocal cord paralysis was attributed to trauma associated with the insertion of the Hickman line
